snippet: The presidential candidate would cut taxes for almost everybody and everything — except, it seems, for single mothers, soldiers and municipal bond investors.
abstract: Floyd Norris High & Low Finance column contends 2012 presidential campaign has been the worst for election-year tax rhetoric than any he can remember; points out the most amazing proposal came from Rick Santorum, who would cut taxes for almost everybody and everything--except, it seems, for single mothers, soldiers and municipal bond investors; posits that no matter how much talk there is about cutting spending, the government needs to raise more revenue than it is getting now to finance needed operations while reducing benefits.
lead_paragraph: The presidential candidate would cut taxes for almost everybody and everything — except, it seems, for single mothers, soldiers and municipal bond investors.
